<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Rat Swarm](/Monsters.aspx?ID=347)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

A swarm of rats can cause total chaos within a household or business. Contracting filth fever is all the easier when dozens of these agitated or hungry vermin gather to bite victims en masse, making rat-hunting a viable career in many parts of the world as desperate townspeople seek relief from the disease’s spread.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Animal](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10)): DC 15

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 13

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 10
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 1">[Rat Swarm](/Monsters.aspx?ID=347)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="N" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Large" />
<trait label="Animal" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=9" />
<trait label="Swarm" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=239" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Bestiary](/Sources.aspx?ID=2) pg. 276</row>

**Perception** +5; low-light vision, scent (imprecise) 30 feet

**Languages**

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +8, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +4, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +6

<row gap="medium">
**Str** -2

**Dex** +3

**Con** +1

**Int** -4

**Wis** +1

**Cha** -3
</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 14 

**Fort** +2 

**Ref** +7 

**Will** +4 

</row>

**HP** 14

**Immunities**
precision, swarm mind

**Resistances**
physical 6 (except bludgeoning)

**Weaknesses**
area damage 3, splash damage 3

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 30 feet, climb 10 feet

**Swarming Bites** <actions string="Single Action" />  Each enemy in the swarm’s space takes 1d6 piercing damage and must attempt a DC 17 basic Reflex save. A creature that fails its save is exposed to filth fever.

**Filth Fever**  ([Disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46)) The [sickened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34) and [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38) conditions from filth fever don’t improve on their own until the disease is cured. **Saving Throw** DC 14 Fortitude; **Stage 1** carrier with no ill effect (1d4 hours), **Stage 2** [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34) (1 day), **Stage 3** [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34) and [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=35) (1 day), **Stage 4** [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38) (1 day), **Stage 5** dead

</column>
